Package pkgMain

Class PlantCatalogView

java.lang.Object
pkgMain.View
pkgMain.PlantCatalogView
public class PlantCatalogView
extends View
Class - PlantCatalogView, this class is for displaying the catalog of plants the user is able to pick from. It will be scrolled through and plants can be hovered over for additional information or chosen for use. Warnings will be given for plants that are not quite comaptible with the users conditions.
Author:
William Cantera, Diane Vinson, Ben Testani, Jacob Kuchma, Maria Venrooy

    • updateCatalog

      public void updateCatalog​(java.util.ArrayList<Plant> filteredPlants)
      updateCatalog, this method displays the plants that were searched for. It will still display every plant, but set the transparenccy value for the plants that didn't match the search to be near transparent. The relevant images
      Parameters:
      filteredPlants - the list of plants filtered for the search

    • setResizeListeners

      public void setResizeListeners()
      setResizeListeners, sets listeners on the viewport bounds property's for the two scrollPanes in this class. This in turn, calls the resizeManager function to control the behaviour upon resizing.

    • displayCatalog

      public void displayCatalog​(java.util.ArrayList<Plant> plantList)
      displayCatalog, puts all of the plants in the catalog TilePane
      Parameters:
      plantList - the list of plants to be displayed
      shouldMakeImage - whether or not this metfhod should make a new image view
      plantImg - the imageView of the plant to display

    • configurePanes

      public void configurePanes()
      configurePanes, sets the properties needed for the panes in this scene. Adds child nodes to the panes.

    • configureButtons

      public void configureButtons()
      configureButtons, sets the behaviour of the buttons in this scene. For example, doing a mouse press on a button will make it change color until the mouse is released at which point it will change back to its original color.

    • styleManager

      public void styleManager()
      styleManager, sets the colors and font sizes for the buttons and some panes.

    • resizeManager

      public javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<javafx.geometry.Bounds> resizeManager​(javafx.scene.layout.Pane[] paneList)
      resizeManager,
      Parameters:
      paneList - the panes to have listeners set to them.
      Returns:
      listener a listener to resize bounds when change is detected.

    • makeImage

      public javafx.scene.image.ImageView makeImage​(Plant p)
      makeImage, makes the ImageView's seen in the catalog portion of the screen. Sets their mosue actions to create a copy of itself in the user plant storage space and display information about the plant when hovered over.

    • makeCopy

      public void makeCopy​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView dragged)
      makeCopy, when a plant in the catalog is clicked, a copy of it is sent to the users plant storage box, which is a flowpane. The user can then drag the plant around.
      Parameters:
      dragged - the image that was selected from the catalog

    • makeHover

      public void makeHover​(Plant p)
      makeHover, when a plant is hovered over in the catalog, a window displaying an image of the plant and information about is pops up. It remainds there until another plant is hovered over, in which case it is replaced with a description of that plant.
      Overrides:
      makeHover in class View
      Parameters:
      p - the plant to be displayed
